metadata.name: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
metadata.comment: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /lockscreenurl:')) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.jpg')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.jpeg')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.png'))) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('reg delete')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\personalizationcsp'))))

output.summary: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

metadata.objective: Examine fields: process.cmd_line, process.parent_process.cmd_line False positive: False positives depend on scripts and administrative tools used in the monitored environment References: https://labs.sentinelone.com/living-off-windows-land-a-new-native-file-downldr/, https://twitter.com/SBousseaden/status/1278977301745741825
